Mini Normal 1692 – A Crack In Time?


Prologue

'So, that's supposed to be the away team, isn't it?' Asked Org0011. He was one of the Chief Organizators.
'Yes, Sir. And,' The Executor paused for a split second, 'I've checked each member's Timeline personally.'
'Good. Now, let's get down to business. Here are the names we should get rid of.' Org0011 gave a small plastic tablet to him. He wondered whether he could trust the new Executor but... his records were good and this seemed to be an easy mission anyway. A perfect start for a new one.
'What sort of names are these?!' Asked the Executor raising his eyebrows.
'Oh, those are not real names. So-called nick-names.'
'Threat Level?'
'2. Normally.'
'Which means...' pondered the Executor.
'Unless they start talking to each other, none of them would ever reach 4 alone. But if they began to do so... the consequences might be unpredictable.'
'So, we are to prevent their communication. How – and when?'
'Take this,' Org0011 handed over a small green disk. 'Find a computer with Internet access. I think you'll find one easily even at that time.' He gave the Executor another tablet.
'10. 10. 2006? I learnt History, Sir. Internet Access had become very common before the Sixth Critical Date.'
'Indeed.' He wants to look smart but it will sort itself later out how smart he really is, thought the Org.
'Anything else we should be aware of, Sir?'
'Nothing. Good Riddance, Executor! Do not fail us.'

The Executor turned around. 'You've heard the Org. On board, everyone!'

Thirteen people, one by one, entered The House.

The House indeed looked like a house and it was big enough for at least thrice as much people. Even better: it had the ability to look like a house from outside. Wherever and when-ever it went, it looked so ...natural as if it had been there all the time.
One day they'd be able to build a smaller time machine, they said. But until then, The House was the best – the only solution for the trip.

As the last person entered the door, the Executor followed. No one saw the strange expression on his face.

Without any sound The House disappeared. The trip to the past started.'


________

RULES

(Stolen from multiple sources Found somewhere in Space/Time ^_^)

General Rules

(1) Unless it's stated in a different way, general site rules are applied.
(2) If you're in doubt contact me via PM.
(3) Although these are in the general site rules, I'm pointing out a couple of things. Firstly, do not quote or share your Role PM. Paraphrasing is fine.
(4) Do not talk about ongoing games. This goes for games you're dead in and games played on other sites too.
(5) Do not use encrypted and/or unreadable (eg. very small) text.
(6) Play to win. Do not play against your Win Condition.
(7) Do not be a douchebag, please! Attack the posts, not the player itself.
(8) My color is Violet (#8000FF), do not use it, please!
(9) If you pretend to break a rule, you will face the same consequences as if you had broken that rule for real.
(10) If I happen to change the rules (which is unlikely anyway), you will get informed about it.


Mechanics and Activity

(11) This is a closed Setup. There are no Roles with explicitely Non-Normal mechanics (eg. Lyncher, Jester, Nexus, etc).
(12) The flavour is providing a story for the game. Although it is worth reading it, it contains NO information about possible factions, roles or alignments.
(13) The game has a Day Start.
(14) The Scum faction(s) have Daytalk.
(15) The Day Phases last for 14 days.
(16) The Night Phases last for 2 days. If a player who has any Night Action doesn't inform me about his Night Action, No Action will happen.
(17) If a player has been inactive for 48 hours, they will get a Prod. After the Prod has happened, they will have 24 hours to post in the thread or else they will be replaced.
(18) As soon as a player gets their third prod, they get replaced automatically unless they start posting before a replacement is found.
(19) If you are planning to be inactive for a certain period, inform me about it via PM or in the thread.
(20) In special cases a Deadline extension may occour, but do not bank on it.

Voting and Lynching
(21) You can vote by using the vote tag, eg. VOTE: Aneninen or by bold text in the following format: Vote: Aneninen.
(22) You need not Unvote if you want to change your vote.
(23) Votes are preferred being posted in a separate line.
(24) As long as I am able to resolve whom are you voting for, I will accept your vote. This goes for obvious abbreviations like VOTE: Ane.
(25) If I think it is a vote, it is a vote.
(26) Votes posted in quotes and/or spoilers are ignored automatically. This may (but not esentially will) go for badly-formatted quotes too. I am not obligated to fix your posts or tags.
(27) When the majority of the living players are voting for the same person (typically half of the players +1; the exact number always appears alongside the Vote Count) a Lynch is achieved. The same amount of votes are needed for a No Lynch; in this case everyone survives the Day phase. If all living players are voting for Draw, the game ends with a Draw.
(28) After a Lynch (or a No Lynch) has been achieved, you may post in the thread until I lock it, but all further votes will be ignored.
(29) If you are dead, you are dead. Period. You are not allowed to post in the game any more. Not even "Bah" posts.
(30) If the Deadline is reached without a Lynch, the Day ends with No Lynch.

Game Over

Chapter One


It was time.
All of them knew it. Actually some of them even knew that they had been way "over-time" but none of them dared to question the Executor.

They didn't really have the opportunity to question him anyway.
As the trip started he went into the Control Room, set the door on Do Not Disturb and since then noone saw him coming out.

Although they had been having fun during the trip (and to tell the truth, none of them had cared a lot about the Executor), as the Arrival Time approached, they got more and more nervous.

'Okay, that's enough,' said the bravest of them. 'I'll check him what he's doing. We all know that we should have arrived by now. Even if we're not talking about it.'

Noone hold him back as he waked to the door.
Surprisingly, it wasn't locked at all.

It took a couple of seconds until he realized what happened.
'Everyone! Come over here!' He roared.
All of them run into the Control Room.

The Executor was lying on the floor. He was shot.

'Do not touch anything!' Someone shouted. 'We need to collect every clue. Someone has killed him and it's obvious that it was one of us.'
'But what about the mission?' Asked another one. 'We are supposed to-'
'Check this out!' A third member of the group pointed at The Timer. 'It's..'
'10. 10. ...1968??!' Someone realized. 'That...'
'...belongs to the Forbidden Time.' a calm voice finished the sentence. 'What WAS he up to?'
'We need to reprogramme The House as fast as we can. Where's that tablet? It shoud be here.' That was another member of the group opening a drawer. 'Here it is,' said while picking up the tablet. 'Let me handle this, I know how to operate it.'
'Why YOU?' shouted a nervous voice. 'How could we know that it wasn't you who-'

'STOP!' interrupted someone the forthcoming fight. 'What do you think of this?' He took out the disk of the opened drawer and held it high. It was a red one.
'That's...' someone started.
'...not the same disk.'
'I saw it too!' another shout was heard. 'It was green, I saw it!'
'That means one thing...' a calm one who had been silent until now summarized what everyone thought. 'Some people in our group are agaist our Mission.'

'That's impossible' snapped someone. 'We all heard it. The Executor checked each of us personally.'
'Well, the Executor's dead. I don't know what he was up to, but it's clear that he didn't check any of us.'
'And you know this because...'
'It's obvious,' the calm voice went on. 'Some people in The House are against our Mission. They want to go back in time to do something else. I think their plan was the following: killing the Executor, changing the Disk and proceeding whatever they wanted to.'
'But the Time...,' asked someone.
'They didn't suspect that the Executor would betray all of us. They were just as surprised as all of us that we haven't arrived yet.'
'So, if he hadn't tried to travel to another Time, their would be successful by now...'
'Ironically, yes.'

'Now what?' The question was asked after a long silence.
'Well, it will take some time to get back to the Time we wanted to go. We're decades away again, but in the other direction. We need to sort everything out by ourselves.'
'Can't we just return?' Asked another nervous voice.
'To admit that we've failed? We'd never be allowed to travel anymore.'
'Oh, sh--.'
'So, who agrees with my theory?' The calm one interrupted the conversation.
Some instantly, others with a little pause, but everyone raised their hands.
'Who thinks that we should sort it out, finish our mission and return when everything's ready?'
Yet again, everyone agreed.

'So, let's get to work. Examine everything we could. And remember. We can trust no one. Anyone can be against our mission. Even me.'


Aneninen, Space/Time Saboteur was killed at Night 0


Day1 has started.

Thirteen travellers.
Left their well-constructed, predictable lives behind to get involved in an adventure.
Although none of them saw the whole picture – and none of them were allowed to do so –, all of them knew that the adventure had taken an unpredictable turn. No, that was not the right expression. Impossibly Unpredictable turn. That described the situation much more properly.

But they weren't thinking about the Time/Likelihood Matrix then. (As if they had learnt anything useful about the Impossibly Unpredictable territory of it.)

They were focusing only on the things which were right in front of them. Including on each other. Mostly on each other. 'Trust is luxury', they learnt that too, but they had never experienced the real meaning of this phrase before.

'Who knows this song?'

None of the students put their hands up.

'Noone. Then all of you must have missed this hit song from the late 1990s. Well, well. I thought you'd learnt history.'

There was scattered murmur from everywhere.

'Okay. Who can tell me why noone knows this song?'

'Maybe' one of the students started 'it has never been written?'

'Good. You're going to places. Literally.
Our young fellow gets the point' the lecturer continued. 'It's never existed.'
'Let me tell you a story.
In the summer of 1999, somewhere in Ibiza... there was a young lady performing a dance which was so seducing that she was able to draw everyone's attention to herself. THIS was that very song. And the lady was called Liljana Sadlowsky. You all must have learnt about Liljana Sadlowsky.

Imagine another past. Miss Sadlowsky went to the party but this song – its title used have been The Forest, anyway – wasn't played. She got noticed by none, got drunk, fell asleep at the party and left the place next morning. Alone. At this point everything Sadlowsky ever made suddenly changed to "used have made".

So. Who can summarize the point of the story?'

One of the students raised his hand.

'We deleted that song from the past instead of Sadlowsky herself, because it was the weakest point of Sadlowsky's Line.'

'Yes, and no.' The lecturer stopped for a couple of seconds. 'Consider this. How did we delete that song?'

'Erm' another student started 'we prevented someone from making it?'

'Very good. So, if we want to understand the story, we need to examine someone or someTHING else instead of our well-known rebel...'

Two average-looking, middle-aged men were standing in front of the transparent board. They were looking at an extremely complicated flowchart.

'I want you to express your honest opinion.' Proc05 started. 'Where do you think this Timeline should be attacked?'

'My intuition says,' Proc29 paused for a second 'this would do the trick'. He pointed at a long, cyan line. 'But, it's an intuition, so it must be wrong, mustn't it?'

'To tell the truth, that was my very first idea too.' Proc05 simled. 'I went along with the essential calculations and it would lead to the worst possible Off-Vector. Frequent manned space missions would be back at p=0.23 My next idea was...' he adjusted a few knobs at the lower part of the board. Some parts of the flowchart faded away, whereas other parts got sharper. '...this point.'

'Interesting' Proc29 pondered. 'It would take out three of the threats. Even better, the most important ones. However, it looks very risky.'

'Actually it is. Prone to attacks and Slips too. There's another possibility, though... just wait a bit...' his hand were working busily on the knobs. 'Maybe... it muts be somewhere ove-'

'Wait! Can you go back to that junction?' Proc29 interrupted his collegue. After some more knobbing an unusually complex part of the flowchart jumped in front. 'What's that?'

'I haven't examined it thoroughly yet.'

'Can you see it? Everyone involved has a connection to this place.' Proc29's fingers were running over some dark lines. 'What sort of place is that anyway, It seems to have connections with ...thousands of people.'

'It's too big for a real place. It may be on the Internet. However, it projects a twine to this area... and this...'

'What if we-'

'...attacked the place itself?' Proc05 finished the sentence of the other one. 'I think we need to do all the calculations to this place, instead of the persons involved. Thanks for your idea!'

'It seems to be long work. But I think I can give you a hand.'

Eleven travellers.

Having searched the belongings of Radja they found one of the disks. The red one.

'Good.' Said OhGodMyLife. 'And now, let me finish my job. And you may stay alive.'

'What?!' Shouted ZZZX 'It was you! It was you all the time!'

'I seriously thought that you all might be cleverer. Say, RadiantCowbells figured it out. A pity that he's not here, isn't it?' OhGodMyLife laughed.

'You may kill me if you wish. But you WILL NEVER SABOTAGE OUR MISSION!'

'Of course I will, of course. What are you to do? Leave this place and live in 2006 or what?'

'You're not as smart as you think. Loranthaceae knew how to crack the webpage. I found his notes. And... you know, none of us were here without purpose. I, for example, am able to connect the computer of The House to the Internet of the current time. Mafiascum is down. It's over for good.'

'HOW DID YOU DARE?!' This time OhGodMyLife shouted.

'See?' ZZZX laughed hysterically. 'All your efforts have been for nothing! NOTHING!'

'You don't understand anything! Do you want to know the truth? You've just separated quite a couple of players from each other! Yes, some players of that page! Together they would have been able to make the world a better place!'

'WE've been making the world a better place for a long time! We've kept the world on the right track of Space/Time. We've-'

'On the right track?! Do you know what you're talking about? If you saw the far future... if you saw some of the alternative realities... you'd understand it. Your whole organization is a lie which only cares about its existence. Its power over the world. And by doing so, you've kept removing the progress. The talents of Mankind. You're the real enemy!'

'No... you're lying.' ZZZX shook his head. 'This can't be true.'

'Do you want to join us? To see the truth?'

After a couple of seconds ZZZX started running towards the exit of The House. He hoped that he'd managed to open it before, but

BANG!

He never reached it.

'Fool.' Said OhGodMyLife.


A few minutes later he got back the red disk, put it into the computer and started working. 'You know, ZZZX, you weren't the only one who knew how to do this.' Thought OhGodMyLife.

An hour later – and about month later – Mafiascum was back on the Internet.

Endsequence

'How is it going?' Org0011 asked Tech037.

'In theory, it's done. They're appearing soon.' Tech037 was leaning over a strange control panel.

'And their memories?'

'More or less intact. Or at least, I hope so.'

'Well... it's still better than nothing. At least we could have our personnel back.'

________

'This whole Trip was terrible!' The first traveller appeared on a strange pedestal. It was Slandaar.
'What sort of bullsh-t of arrangament was that? It SHOULD HAVE NEVER HAPPENED! The whole Trip, even The House was against us! There must be a traitor amongst YOUR caste!' He pointed at Org0011 menaningly. 'And I'll find out who they are!'

'At least I tried my best'. Zoronos materialized. 'What the hell could I have done? We've never learnt about situations like this!'

'Why me? Why ME?! What did I do wrong?' That was PirateMollie. 'Can someone answer this? Can someone tell me WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON?!'

'I knew it! I KNEW IT!' RadiantCowbells was the next one. 'You should have listened to me! You all should have! Now you've learnt it in the hard way!'

'Well, don't blame me.' Thor665's first words were quite calm. 'It was smurphing confusing. Really. And I still don't remember a lot of things. Trips like this should be supervised by some elders, I think. Oh, and I'm really sorry, Mollie!'

The next traveller was a mere silhouette. Boonskiies was waving to the others. 'I'm not coming back here. You're against our kind. Now I know it for sure. Thanks and goodbye! See you in a different Space/Time. Without prejudices.' He disappeared in the next second.

'Wait!' That was BlueMoonRising. 'I don't think I should be here at all. I, actually... found something interesting and... let me think... oh never mind. 01. 07. 1995' he mumbled the last numbers quietly. Very, very quietly.

'Okay, that's it!' Loranthaceae appeared to be very nervous. 'I want to quit! I want to get back to my own time! NOW! This whole organization is more like a dis-organization! Leave me alone!'

'What happened?' Ricastle arrived. 'Were we successful? Oh... I think I know the answer. It was too quick. Or too slow? Oh please, where's a Doc?'

'...' ZZZX said nothing. He just left the room without adding anything.

________

'So?' At an entirely different place, in an entirely different time, there was another report.

'It's only me.' Answered OhGodMyLife. 'But, we've made it.'

'Good. That's the first step. We'll check the third part of 2016 whether we've been right. Until then...'

________

'Well, that's not much.' Org0011 summarized the situation.

'Better than nothing.' The answer came.

'And now? Should we be prepared for threats like this?'

'We've been facing their actions for a long time. Even if it's not known by most of you. So, this story will be a secret. Now and forever.'

'Understood.' Said Org0011. 'And now?'

'Haven't you realized that we have a new problem too?'

'...Which is?'

'What DID that impostor Executor wanted to do in 1968??!!'
